intro: Endostemon usambarensis, commonly known as the Usambaran mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the Eastern Arc Mountains of Tanzania. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of trees such as Terminalia and Ficus. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, white or greenish flowers that are pollinated by insects. Its berries are usually red or yellow and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Endostemon usambarensis plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food for certain bird species and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
